result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua C Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua C Fields

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua C Fields in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered on Count 1. 
Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty. 
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician 
Defendant must report to office of P&P today. 
Appeal rights explained.
